text: Although the innate thirst of vampires cannot be completely eradicated, Jade-Blooded Taoists who deeply study the Wind of Life can significantly restrain their restless desires.
Due to their racial traits, Jade-Blooded Taoists cannot ride living creatures despite their deeper affinity with nature. However, this has granted them supernatural speed.
It is said that "Yingchuo" is an illusion of the Moon Empress. Only when hearing its call can the Black Jade Crowmen channel the Wind of Yin and transform into the mythical bird.
The heroic soul forever recorded in history, forged into an eternal legend through bravery and resilience, inspiring the people of Cathay to charge forward with courage.
The mysterious jade forms this body, guiding the terracotta to channel the Dragon Emperor’s might, circulating and nourishing the lands of the Celestial Empire.
To live as a hero, to die as a legend. Standing proudly between heaven and earth, unyielding in name and unbroken in spirit.

One aspect of the Great Horned Rat’s terrifying visage is the Lord of Catastrophe, a living calamity that brings devastation and desolation from the Chaos Realms filled with destruction and slaughter.

After being expelled from the Dwarven Engineer Guild, Malakai felt deeply humiliated and took the Slayer’s Oath, adopting the garb and demeanor of a Slayer.
The Spirit of Grungni is a thunderbarge created by the Dwarven Butcher Engineer Malakai Makaisson.
Malakai is always willing to lend a helping hand—and a thunderbarge.
Malakai wanted to create a new machine for throwing axes. Hmm? A new machine? That would take too long! It’s easier to train Rangers to throw axes accurately.
Malakai’s latest invention: a handheld multi-barrel gun, unlike the Hellblaster Volley Gun. For now, it’s just a prototype, but mass production might follow.
The sinking of the Unsinkable Ironclad marked the beginning of Malakai’s end. Much can be learned from that tragedy.
The destruction of the airship Indestructible taught us valuable lessons about time management, communication, and proper material handling.
It turns out the Spirit of Grungni's hold can accommodate quite a lot of explosives.
Malakai’s firearm can be upgraded to fire full-size rounds. Rough calculations indicate at least a 65% increase per shot.
This skill is used to manage surplus skill points. It has no effect and can be chosen up to 99 times.

Yingchuo is the Moon Empress' personal gift to Hong Ying, a Taeyue Luan rumored to be the Moon Empress' shadow. Only through hearing its cry can the Onyx Crowmen channel the Wind of Yin and transform into a mythical bird.
A mighty weapon brought from the Moon Empress’s abode, its blade is as clear as the moon, with flowing obsidian-like fire capable of easily breaking the magic of opposing weapons.
Hong Ying possesses an uncanny affinity with the Wind of Shadows. His “staff” is the obsidian flame on his blade, which rises and shifts to channel winds or slay targets when needed.
Legend has it this mask was carved by the Shadow Dragon itself. The wearer can vanish into shadows, move with the wind on the battlefield, and strike generals unseen.
This feather-light cloak symbolizes the master of the Shadow Crow Guard and is the only means, other than Yuanbo, to directly command the Black Jade Crowmen.

The Laurel Pavilion is divided into three guards, and only their masters may hold this token. Hong Ying’s Shadow Crow Guard is tasked with gathering intelligence and carrying out assassinations, their authority akin to the Moon Empress herself.

Since childhood, Hong Ying has been followed by illusions of the divine bird Yu Zhuo. After joining the Laurel Pavilion, Black Jade Crowmen whispered of the vanished power of the Shadow Dragon—a power filled with pain and sacrifice.
The eyes of the Celestial Court pierce all realms; the expanse of their wings covers the skies, guarding the Celestial Empire far and wide.
Born with an affinity for the Wind of Shadows, Hong Ying mastered assassination techniques personally taught by the Moon Empress, striking as shadows and departing like the wind.
Changqi’s disciples believe their schemes flawless as they revel, unaware someone in the adjacent room is diligently sketching their plans…
Swift as the wind and powerful as thunder, he strides through enemy camps with unparalleled bravery.
Night is the best concealment for shadows. The deepest shadow moves alone, waiting for the opportune moment to strike before the enemy realizes their fate.
The master of the Shadow Crow Guard commands the flock, appearing alone while a myriad of crows await in the shadows, ready to swarm at their signal.
Amid the surging tides of espionage, they navigate with ease, leading their subordinates to unravel complex schemes, exemplifying excellence in covert operations.
The outlines of the Celestial Court shimmer faintly in the night, while the moonlit sky is dotted with black feathers, resembling endless gems encrusted in the heavens.
This draconic steed is jet black from head to hoof, galloping ten thousand li by day and eight thousand by night—thus named “Cloudstrider of Ten Thousand Li.”
Muster riders, prepare soldiers, feed horses, sharpen blades, and strengthen formations—this is the path to victory.
Discipline yourself with introspection, reflect thrice daily, bask in the moon’s glow, carry the dignity of the Dragon Emperor—never falter in virtue or decorum.
Let golden steel reflect a loyal heart—leave no regrets nor unspoken laments.
You beasts and barbarian fiends—halt! Who dares face even half my hammer swing?!
His immense magical power, innate since birth, hammers and tempers Xuan Lie’s body day and night—granting him divine might to shatter mountains and tear down walls.

Golden helm, golden armor, cinnabar robe; purple eyes, crimson brows, azure mane. As drums thunder and banners flash, the earth trembles and the heavens stir. His mount is born of dragon blood—how could petty daemons escape? When we return in triumph, general, we shall lay down our arms together.
A golden hammer crowned with a beast’s head, its head infused with the spirit of a temple guardian—its strikes tear through ranks like a dragon's claws.

The prototype of these machines dates back to the Gold Age’s great mining rush. Buried beneath rubble after countless engineers and miners were lost to the green tide, they were only recently unearthed. Now, restored and mass-produced, the survivors of that long-ago tragedy ride them into battle to finally settle the score with the Greenskins and Skaven filth.
When Hafdan won the Dwarfen drinking contest, he met Grelid. As they escaped from a Dark Elf Black Ark, a storm swept Grelid away—leaving only his heirloom rune helm behind.
This armor, forged by a renowned Dwarf master, is etched with lost runes of thunder. It channels Hafdan’s inner lightning and repels surrounding Chaos energies.
After defeating the Bonegrinder chieftain in single combat, Hafdan seized a golden rune from the giants’ treasure hoard. With it comes an irresistible charisma that draws warriors to his cause.
I shall raise Mjolnir high and rally Kislev beneath one banner—let the thunder of the skies wash away our ancient shame!
When the god-hammer struck down with lightning, it left an eternal bolt-shaped scar on Hafdan’s chest. This mark renders Thor’s Chosen invulnerable and tireless in battle.
Kislev’s once-clear skies have long been shrouded in darkness. But today, the divine hammer falls, thunder roars, and shame is cast away in radiant vengeance!
For too long, Norscan raiders, Skaven, and Daemons have tormented our homeland. Now it’s time they taste the suffering they have inflicted!
Countless loyal soldiers have bled across tundra, walls, homesteads, and shrines. Yet their blood and the frost have forged bodies and wills that cannot be broken.
Thor’s blessing grants us unmatched speed and strength—let us charge forth like a thunderous tide of ruin!
I always arrive where my comrades need me most. I will not fall. I do not stop!
Behind us stands the Motherland—Kislev itself! Under Thor’s gaze, we shall stand united!
I carry the glory of the Thunder God. In Thor’s name I raise the divine hammer—Chaos shall not breach our homeland!
Every scar is a badge of honor. Every battle brings us one step closer to victory!
This heaven-sent hammer marked a turning point in Hafdan’s life. When he grips its handle, he hears the divine voice of Thor guiding him through every battle.

When indestructibility is wielded as a weapon, nothing is unbreakable. This massive hammer, which requires multiple Kroxigors to carry, moves as fluidly as a limb in Old-Kan’s hands. A casual swing melds warm-bloods and their prized armor into a single, gory mass.

Though soft metals offer no defense to its hardened scales, they reflect brilliantly—making Old-Kan’s massive frame a gleaming beacon, guiding Lizardmen warriors behind him to follow the bloody path he carves.
Sharp, heavy, and infused with the wild blessings of the Beast-God Itzi, this great axe, honed by legions of Skink smiths, can decapitate the thickest-necked Carnosaur in a single blow.
Assembled from the most prized trophies of Old-K’ja’s conquests, this thick armor endures even the searing heat of Solar Engines—arrows and bullets barely register.
Blood of the Old Ones, blessings of the Beast-God—these make them mightier than their kin.
Battles involving Old-Kan rarely last long—a blood-slicked titan crashing through ranks is terrifying to any warm-blood.
They tire not. They break not. Their might knows no end.
Their gleaming presence on the battlefield stirs courage among allies.
From the moment they emerged from the spawning pool, these twin Kroxigors were different—larger, stronger, and even… smarter.
Blood of the Old Ones, blessings of the Beast-God—these make them mightier than their kin.
Old-K’ja grows stronger with every clash, driven by obsession for worthy foes and hunger to prove his might.
This berserking titan crashes through crowds, leaving carnage in its wake.
Don't let it fixate on you. It hasn’t quite grasped the concept of 'holding back'...
From the moment they emerged from the spawning pool, these twin Kroxigors were different—larger, stronger, and even… smarter.
A towering beast of bone and flame, bearing Khorne’s warshrine upon its back, trudging through blood and mud while leaving behind scorched limbs and charred remains.
A towering beast of bone and flame, bearing Khorne’s warshrine upon its back, trudging through blood and mud while leaving behind scorched limbs and charred remains.
